HDG.IM.content: knowing resolution to essence of Being (from Rectoral Address) [but you haven’t answered Nietzsche’s question yet!!!] > [spirit is Being of beings?] [spirit as authenticator of beings]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: knowing resolution to essence of Being (from Rectoral Address) [but you haven’t answered Nietzsche’s question yet!!!] > [spirit is Being of beings?] [spirit as authenticator of beings]

HDG.IM.content: emptiness of word “Being,” complete withering of its naming force, not just particular case of general abuse of language: the destroyed relation to Being as such [the name?] is real ground for whole misrelation to language [how do you know this if you haven’t answered Nietzsche yet?] [if it is exemplary, what does the particular name matter?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: emptiness of word “Being,” complete withering of its naming force, not just particular case of general abuse of language: the destroyed relation to Being as such [the name?] is real ground for whole misrelation to language [how do you know this if you haven’t answered Nietzsche yet?] [if it is exemplary, what does the particular name matter?]

HDG.BC.content: knowing, standing, a stance, knowing ground is more originary, more far-reaching [value], more decisive: this knowing is character itself > a claim upon us, exhorted (angesprochen) [addressed] > meleta to pan, “take into care beings as a whole”: always consider the essential, first & last [put last first]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: knowing, standing, a stance, knowing ground is more originary, more far-reaching [value], more decisive: this knowing is character itself > a claim upon us, exhorted (angesprochen) [addressed] > meleta to pan, “take into care beings as a whole”: always consider the essential, first & last [put last first]

HDG.BC.content: man, ready for what is always original, or knows better > universal currency of historiological science, calculating “attitude” toward history, begins w/ ascendancy of Christianity: relation to essential reckoned into otherwise calculable
HDG.BC.linkedContent: man, ready for what is always original, or knows better > universal currency of historiological science, calculating “attitude” toward history, begins w/ ascendancy of Christianity: relation to essential reckoned into otherwise calculable

HDG.BC.content: must know Greek language [authenticity] [but Heidegger against phony cultural inheritance] > knowledge of Greek no proof that he can think acc. the thought
HDG.BC.linkedContent: must know Greek language [authenticity] [but Heidegger against phony cultural inheritance] > knowledge of Greek no proof that he can think acc. the thought

HDG.BC.content: [phony inheritance] love of antiquity pretext to evade every decisive reflection > readiness to confront inception more vital than knowledge of any languages [but still must know Greek?] > readiness can originate as genuine (echte) only from necessities of history in which we’re placed: insistence on possession of truth makes remembrance of inception impossible
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [phony inheritance] love of antiquity pretext to evade every decisive reflection > readiness to confront inception more vital than knowledge of any languages [but still must know Greek?] > readiness can originate as genuine (echte) only from necessities of history in which we’re placed: insistence on possession of truth makes remembrance of inception impossible

HDG.BC.content: resolve to attain essential knowing [to-come] need not, at first, concern itself w/ inception of our history [how so?] > applying to ourselves the test of whether we are setting out on path of reflection: inner freedom
HDG.BC.linkedContent: resolve to attain essential knowing [to-come] need not, at first, concern itself w/ inception of our history [how so?] > applying to ourselves the test of whether we are setting out on path of reflection: inner freedom

HDG.BC.content: [on style] Ground-Concepts as demand to reach ground of all that is, of what can therefore be called beings > anticipation of essential (Wesenhaft) more vital (wesentlich) than certainty of calculating the w/out essence (Wesenlos) > thinking in anticipation (Ahnen), for anticipation, essentially more rigorous/exacting than formal-conceptual cleverness of calculable: we must practice such knowing, readiness to make ourselves free for essential
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [on style] Ground-Concepts as demand to reach ground of all that is, of what can therefore be called beings > anticipation of essential (Wesenhaft) more vital (wesentlich) than certainty of calculating the w/out essence (Wesenlos) > thinking in anticipation (Ahnen), for anticipation, essentially more rigorous/exacting than formal-conceptual cleverness of calculable: we must practice such knowing, readiness to make ourselves free for essential

HDG.BC.content: true/wakeful youth has prerogative to develop exhortations to knowledge from out of itself [?] > can the American man know what “reading” means? [w/ all his “newspapers,” social media] > awaken/keep awake binding power of spirit/bindingness of essential
HDG.BC.linkedContent: true/wakeful youth has prerogative to develop exhortations to knowledge from out of itself [?] > can the American man know what “reading” means? [w/ all his “newspapers,” social media] > awaken/keep awake binding power of spirit/bindingness of essential

HDG.BC.content: knowing grammar contributes nothing to our understanding [what about Einführung?] > no doubt about “is” in “weather is fine”—how do we make “is” questionable? > fullness/variability of beings never comes from “is” or being, comes from beings themselves (weather, street, bad, closed, dark)
HDG.BC.linkedContent: knowing grammar contributes nothing to our understanding [what about Einführung?] > no doubt about “is” in “weather is fine”—how do we make “is” questionable? > fullness/variability of beings never comes from “is” or being, comes from beings themselves (weather, street, bad, closed, dark)

HDG.BC.content: we have our residence in the distinction (Unterscheidung) btwn Being/beings [ontological difference] > ontological difference looks negative [isn’t], OD holds differentia apart (hält Unterscheidenes auseinander) [spacing], an extension & expanse, space of all spaces > at first, know nothing of this distinction, of what it consists remains hidden: in fact > whether code word (Kennwortes) “distinction” characterizes its essence remains undecided/unasked > “the distinction” more essential than all differences/oppositions btwn beings
HDG.BC.linkedContent: we have our residence in the distinction (Unterscheidung) btwn Being/beings [ontological difference] > ontological difference looks negative [isn’t], OD holds differentia apart (hält Unterscheidenes auseinander) [spacing], an extension & expanse, space of all spaces > at first, know nothing of this distinction, of what it consists remains hidden: in fact > whether code word (Kennwortes) “distinction” characterizes its essence remains undecided/unasked > “the distinction” more essential than all differences/oppositions btwn beings

HDG.BC.content: Being lets every being as such originate: Being is the origin ——no doubt about Being, the most reliable [but don’t we know Being by way of experience of beings?]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: Being lets every being as such originate: Being is the origin ——no doubt about Being, the most reliable [but don’t we know Being by way of experience of beings?]

HDG.BC.content: instructions (Anweisungen) for reflection [askesis], procure modestly a preparation (Vorbereitung) for resolve to follow meleta to pan, to know what’s incipient in Western thought, what’s said in the inception > struck by word from inceptive saying: clearer readiness (Bereitschaft) for direction (Richtung) toward which we must listen
HDG.BC.linkedContent: instructions (Anweisungen) for reflection [askesis], procure modestly a preparation (Vorbereitung) for resolve to follow meleta to pan, to know what’s incipient in Western thought, what’s said in the inception > struck by word from inceptive saying: clearer readiness (Bereitschaft) for direction (Richtung) toward which we must listen

HDG.BC.content: [slow down] no way out in any direction: Being cast itself toward us—in saying something about Being, we cast it away > perceive the impasse into which Being places us as a sign pointing toward where we already are placed, since we comport ourselves toward beings [presuppositions? also, what is a sign if you already know its parent?] [rather than impasse as aporia: impasse is what it is] > concealed abode, to which essence of our history owes its origin, abode that concerns our essence
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [slow down] no way out in any direction: Being cast itself toward us—in saying something about Being, we cast it away > perceive the impasse into which Being places us as a sign pointing toward where we already are placed, since we comport ourselves toward beings [presuppositions? also, what is a sign if you already know its parent?] [rather than impasse as aporia: impasse is what it is] > concealed abode, to which essence of our history owes its origin, abode that concerns our essence

HDG.BC.content: we know the organism human because we are this type [?] > [funny joke against “anthropology,” presumptuous titles, e.g. “Man”]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: we know the organism human because we are this type [?] > [funny joke against “anthropology,” presumptuous titles, e.g. “Man”]

HDG.BC.content: inception has been, but not something past [inheritance], still presences, but concealed in its incipience [trace], perhaps inception of Being closer to us than everything we know, imperishable (Unvergängliche) [indestructible] > remembrance of inception not concerned w/ beings [how so???], but w/ what has been, i.e. what still presences
HDG.BC.linkedContent: inception has been, but not something past [inheritance], still presences, but concealed in its incipience [trace], perhaps inception of Being closer to us than everything we know, imperishable (Unvergängliche) [indestructible] > remembrance of inception not concerned w/ beings [how so???], but w/ what has been, i.e. what still presences

HDG.WM.content: concession of nothing, always an empty squabble over words? > for science, nothing is an outrage/phantasm (wishes to know nothing about nothing)
HDG.WM.linkedContent: concession of nothing, always an empty squabble over words? > for science, nothing is an outrage/phantasm (wishes to know nothing about nothing)

HDG.QB.content: recollective thinking (Andenken) has task of attending to this concealment, in which unconcealment is grounded [how do you know that, if its essence has not yet been revealed?] > recollect not what becomes past: but all enduring (allem Währen) that each case (je) of Ereignis of X Being grants (gewährt)
HDG.QB.linkedContent: recollective thinking (Andenken) has task of attending to this concealment, in which unconcealment is grounded [how do you know that, if its essence has not yet been revealed?] > recollect not what becomes past: but all enduring (allem Währen) that each case (je) of Ereignis of X Being grants (gewährt)

HDG.FS.content: unthinkable/unachievable that human no longer corresponds to what appears > in age of world impoverishment (in der Verarmung der Welt), only see chemical processes > Descartes not part of this, the 1st to see lightning flash, what is decisive (Entscheidende): das er gesehen werde > can’t know why it gave itself in this way, at least know in scientific sense: “destiny of being” not history as succession of events
HDG.FS.linkedContent: unthinkable/unachievable that human no longer corresponds to what appears > in age of world impoverishment (in der Verarmung der Welt), only see chemical processes > Descartes not part of this, the 1st to see lightning flash, what is decisive (Entscheidende): das er gesehen werde > can’t know why it gave itself in this way, at least know in scientific sense: “destiny of being” not history as succession of events

HDG.FS.content: destruction, strong sense of de-struere, Ab-bauen (“dis-mantling”), not devastation (Verwüsten) > destruction strives to free original meaning of Being, this original meaning is presence (Anwesenheit), governs all Greek understanding of being (w/out its knowing it) [presence worthy of the name?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: destruction, strong sense of de-struere, Ab-bauen (“dis-mantling”), not devastation (Verwüsten) > destruction strives to free original meaning of Being, this original meaning is presence (Anwesenheit), governs all Greek understanding of being (w/out its knowing it) [presence worthy of the name?]

HDG.FS.content: Fichte absolutized Cartesian cogito, leads to ABSOLUTE KNOWLEDGE, place of absolute certainty, in which absolute knowledge knows itself
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Fichte absolutized Cartesian cogito, leads to ABSOLUTE KNOWLEDGE, place of absolute certainty, in which absolute knowledge knows itself

HDG.FS.content: “philosophy” today behind science, misses 2 sole realities of today: 1) development of business (der wirtschaftlichen Entwicklung) 2) correlated armament (Rüstung) [Marxism knows these realities]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: “philosophy” today behind science, misses 2 sole realities of today: 1) development of business (der wirtschaftlichen Entwicklung) 2) correlated armament (Rüstung) [Marxism knows these realities]

HDG.FS.content: Kantian “Copernican revolution”: the thing is adjusted in advance to power of knowing, category “substance” brings manifold of hyletic data into definite form, object posited as synthesis of intuition/concept > for Kant, knowledge = bringing-into-form (accomplished by understanding)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Kantian “Copernican revolution”: the thing is adjusted in advance to power of knowing, category “substance” brings manifold of hyletic data into definite form, object posited as synthesis of intuition/concept > for Kant, knowledge = bringing-into-form (accomplished by understanding)

HDG.FS.content: there is a return to beginning in Being and Time, but it is through destruction, dismantling, disintegration (Auflösung) (which is sometimes awkward [ungeschickt] [?]) of what is destined as being in metaphysics > not yet in Being and Time a genuine knowledge of history of being, hence the awkwardness, naiveté of “ontological destruction” > since then, unavoidable naiveté of novice gave way to a knowing [he arrived, no more destruction?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: there is a return to beginning in Being and Time, but it is through destruction, dismantling, disintegration (Auflösung) (which is sometimes awkward [ungeschickt] [?]) of what is destined as being in metaphysics > not yet in Being and Time a genuine knowledge of history of being, hence the awkwardness, naiveté of “ontological destruction” > since then, unavoidable naiveté of novice gave way to a knowing [he arrived, no more destruction?]

HDG.CCP.content: one often doesn’t know whose tale he retells [baby daddy] > releasement as experience of waiting: release oneself into openness of Gegnet, waiting a relation to Gegnet, perhaps the relation > “relation to something would be the true relation if it were held in its own nature by that which it relates” [hetero-tautology, Derrida beyond Heidegger]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: one often doesn’t know whose tale he retells [baby daddy] > releasement as experience of waiting: release oneself into openness of Gegnet, waiting a relation to Gegnet, perhaps the relation > “relation to something would be the true relation if it were held in its own nature by that which it relates” [hetero-tautology, Derrida beyond Heidegger]

HDG.WL.content: [method of arrival, in the instant?] we need a plain, sudden, unforgettable thus forever new look (Blick) into something we don’t even try to know > the quick and stirring regsames Erregende) of Saying: earliest/most ancient at once, region of all places, first break of dawn for all that is present/absent, that which makes the cycle of day/night possible: Das Regende im Zeigen der Sage ist das Eignen ——Eignen (Owning) that moves Saying as Showing is Ereignis, yields (er-gibt) opening of the clearing, in which present beings can persist (anwähren) & absent beings can depart, while keeping (behalten) their persistence (Währen) in withdrawal (im Entzug) [cf. erasure of trace] > das Ereignende [what is yielding] ist das Ereignis selbst—nothing else > Ereignis can’t be represented as occurrence (Vorkommnis) or happening (Geschehen), “can only be experienced as abiding gift yielded (Gewährende) by saying” > Ereignis is not the result of something, but the giving yield (Er-gebnis), whose giving along gives us Es gibt, to which even Being needs to come [so to come] into its own as presence (um als Anwesen in sein Eigenes zu gelangen)
HDG.WL.linkedContent: [method of arrival, in the instant?] we need a plain, sudden, unforgettable thus forever new look (Blick) into something we don’t even try to know > the quick and stirring regsames Erregende) of Saying: earliest/most ancient at once, region of all places, first break of dawn for all that is present/absent, that which makes the cycle of day/night possible: Das Regende im Zeigen der Sage ist das Eignen ——Eignen (Owning) that moves Saying as Showing is Ereignis, yields (er-gibt) opening of the clearing, in which present beings can persist (anwähren) & absent beings can depart, while keeping (behalten) their persistence (Währen) in withdrawal (im Entzug) [cf. erasure of trace] > das Ereignende [what is yielding] ist das Ereignis selbst—nothing else > Ereignis can’t be represented as occurrence (Vorkommnis) or happening (Geschehen), “can only be experienced as abiding gift yielded (Gewährende) by saying” > Ereignis is not the result of something, but the giving yield (Er-gebnis), whose giving along gives us Es gibt, to which even Being needs to come [so to come] into its own as presence (um als Anwesen in sein Eigenes zu gelangen)

HDG.WL.content: if to know means to see something in wholeness of its nature, we can’t see the nature of language as such, in the round, because we belong w/in Saying, can only say something by saying it after Saying > language is monologue [cf. MONL], has its structure in the Aufriss of Saying: 1) language alone speaks authentically 2) language speaks lonesomely (einsam) > the some in lonesome, the same, Greek hama, Gothic sama, thus lonesome: “same in what unites that which belongs together” > Saying is in need of being voiced in word [Being needs man] > man’s needed usage (Brauchen), his resaying (Nachsagen) of what he listens to, lies in that lack (Fehlen) that isn’t negative or defective
HDG.WL.linkedContent: if to know means to see something in wholeness of its nature, we can’t see the nature of language as such, in the round, because we belong w/in Saying, can only say something by saying it after Saying > language is monologue [cf. MONL], has its structure in the Aufriss of Saying: 1) language alone speaks authentically 2) language speaks lonesomely (einsam) > the some in lonesome, the same, Greek hama, Gothic sama, thus lonesome: “same in what unites that which belongs together” > Saying is in need of being voiced in word [Being needs man] > man’s needed usage (Brauchen), his resaying (Nachsagen) of what he listens to, lies in that lack (Fehlen) that isn’t negative or defective

HDG.WL.content: man can never step out of language & look at it from somewhere else, only see its nature to the extent it has appropriated us to itself > that we cannot know the nature of language is an advantage (Vorzug), we’re favored w/in a special realm (ausgezeichneten Bereich), where we are needed/used (Gebrauchten) by language, where we dwell as mortals
HDG.WL.linkedContent: man can never step out of language & look at it from somewhere else, only see its nature to the extent it has appropriated us to itself > that we cannot know the nature of language is an advantage (Vorzug), we’re favored w/in a special realm (ausgezeichneten Bereich), where we are needed/used (Gebrauchten) by language, where we dwell as mortals

HDG.EC.content: this is all so simple & full of mystery, how could you know all this with such clarity since this morning? > in the simple experience (einfachen Erfahrung) of the coming, as that upon which we wait, what is healing draws near (naht), is granted (geworden) to us [so the experience is already the arrival?] > you say “to us” but it was only granted to you > I would like to share it now w/ you > my experience allows me to name for the you the wound beginning to heal, I was allowed/learned to presage (ahnen) [so priestly all this]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: this is all so simple & full of mystery, how could you know all this with such clarity since this morning? > in the simple experience (einfachen Erfahrung) of the coming, as that upon which we wait, what is healing draws near (naht), is granted (geworden) to us [so the experience is already the arrival?] > you say “to us” but it was only granted to you > I would like to share it now w/ you > my experience allows me to name for the you the wound beginning to heal, I was allowed/learned to presage (ahnen) [so priestly all this]

HDG.EC.content: the unnecessary is most necessary of all, only one who has learned this understands pain of human barred from thinking > thinking is thus the unnecessary, and yet thinking has a high rank of honor: the highest > I know this but don’t know the Grund of this > as if Occident couldn’t wait until thinking finds its originary essence: perhaps pure waiting, ability to wait [slow down, hastiness (Übereilung) of thinking thought as ratio, rationality]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: the unnecessary is most necessary of all, only one who has learned this understands pain of human barred from thinking > thinking is thus the unnecessary, and yet thinking has a high rank of honor: the highest > I know this but don’t know the Grund of this > as if Occident couldn’t wait until thinking finds its originary essence: perhaps pure waiting, ability to wait [slow down, hastiness (Übereilung) of thinking thought as ratio, rationality]

HDG.EC.content: in accustomed translation of mortality, it’s the relation to death, not to the immortals, that is named > only man, not animal, knows death, can go towards death > animal cannot die, cannot have death
HDG.EC.linkedContent: in accustomed translation of mortality, it’s the relation to death, not to the immortals, that is named > only man, not animal, knows death, can go towards death > animal cannot die, cannot have death

HDG.EC.content: your experience of healing now heals me, letting us become those who wait > the far is near in the nearness of what is held in reserve (Aufbehaltenen), the farness (Ferne) of what is dear (Holden) > for those who wait, the difference (Unterschied) btwn near/far opens most purely > those who wait will guard themselves from hastening to know that which heals in itself
HDG.EC.linkedContent: your experience of healing now heals me, letting us become those who wait > the far is near in the nearness of what is held in reserve (Aufbehaltenen), the farness (Ferne) of what is dear (Holden) > for those who wait, the difference (Unterschied) btwn near/far opens most purely > those who wait will guard themselves from hastening to know that which heals in itself

HDG.EC.content: waiting as though we pass unnoticed, unnamed [don’t know what we are], otherwise than all Erwarten, we’re not there for all who await/expect > in waiting, we’ve gone entirely away (ganz weggegangen), to our essence, required (gebraucht) by pure coming as inlet that answers it (als der Einlass, der ihm antwortet)
HDG.EC.linkedContent: waiting as though we pass unnoticed, unnamed [don’t know what we are], otherwise than all Erwarten, we’re not there for all who await/expect > in waiting, we’ve gone entirely away (ganz weggegangen), to our essence, required (gebraucht) by pure coming as inlet that answers it (als der Einlass, der ihm antwortet)

HDG.EC.content: those among a people (Volk) [Germans?] who poetize/think, wait in most noble manner: durch deren Gegenwart [through the present-waiting of the poet] zum Kommen das Wort in die Antwort des Menschenwesens gelangt und also in die Sprache gebracht wird > poets/thinkers wait on the arrival of this essence of theirs [devastation already passed over?], waiting people endangered like no other [rare], endangered not from outside threats but by tyranny of ignorant impatience, continual mistakes > Während dieses voreilige Scheinwesen [rash pseudo-essence] doch nur die ewig unbeholfene Nachahmung des Fremden bleibt [bad imitation of the foreign, Larry] > the people (Volk) who know its essence, can’t insist on it as a special calling (besondere Berufung)/distinction (Auszeichnung) > waiting people entirely unusable (unbrauchbar) to others, what waits yields nothing to be used (Nutzen) for progress > any fame of these people must be squander its essence purely on the unnecessary
HDG.EC.linkedContent: those among a people (Volk) [Germans?] who poetize/think, wait in most noble manner: durch deren Gegenwart [through the present-waiting of the poet] zum Kommen das Wort in die Antwort des Menschenwesens gelangt und also in die Sprache gebracht wird > poets/thinkers wait on the arrival of this essence of theirs [devastation already passed over?], waiting people endangered like no other [rare], endangered not from outside threats but by tyranny of ignorant impatience, continual mistakes > Während dieses voreilige Scheinwesen [rash pseudo-essence] doch nur die ewig unbeholfene Nachahmung des Fremden bleibt [bad imitation of the foreign, Larry] > the people (Volk) who know its essence, can’t insist on it as a special calling (besondere Berufung)/distinction (Auszeichnung) > waiting people entirely unusable (unbrauchbar) to others, what waits yields nothing to be used (Nutzen) for progress > any fame of these people must be squander its essence purely on the unnecessary

HDG.OHF.content: hermeneutics meant to achieve an existential knowing, i.e., a being (ein Sein) > Sie spricht aus der Ausgelegtheit und für sie [language speaks]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: hermeneutics meant to achieve an existential knowing, i.e., a being (ein Sein) > Sie spricht aus der Ausgelegtheit und für sie [language speaks]

HDG.OHF.content: philosophy a mode of knowing in factical life itself, in which factical Dasein ruthlessly dragged back to itself, relentlessly thrown back (zurückreisst) on itself [cf. CPC p. 13]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: philosophy a mode of knowing in factical life itself, in which factical Dasein ruthlessly dragged back to itself, relentlessly thrown back (zurückreisst) on itself [cf. CPC p. 13]

HDG.OHF.content: covering up of soil from which which definition of human arose: logon exon, animal rationale [rational becomes the logical], Christian Dasein as person capable of knowing, human cut to the measure of faith (glaubensmässig vorbestimmt) as being-created (Geschaffensein) in image of God
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: covering up of soil from which which definition of human arose: logon exon, animal rationale [rational becomes the logical], Christian Dasein as person capable of knowing, human cut to the measure of faith (glaubensmässig vorbestimmt) as being-created (Geschaffensein) in image of God

HDG.OHF.content: how dialectic places itself above phenomenology: 1) best phenomenology can do: define appearance of Spirit in its 1st stage 2) dialectic alone can penetrate irrational > it’s true, phenomenology is 1st stage of immediate knowledge—but only from point of view of dialectic [nothing can be decided here, dialectic already presupposed] > phenomenology does place limit on knowing (is that a defect?)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: how dialectic places itself above phenomenology: 1) best phenomenology can do: define appearance of Spirit in its 1st stage 2) dialectic alone can penetrate irrational > it’s true, phenomenology is 1st stage of immediate knowledge—but only from point of view of dialectic [nothing can be decided here, dialectic already presupposed] > phenomenology does place limit on knowing (is that a defect?)

HDG.OHF.content: being everywhere & nowhere of philosophical knowing: an absolute curiosity (Neugier) [Heidegger then describes something close to idle talk, how philosophy is public, has an autonomous curiosity, gives itself a foothold in life, thus preserving itself]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: being everywhere & nowhere of philosophical knowing: an absolute curiosity (Neugier) [Heidegger then describes something close to idle talk, how philosophy is public, has an autonomous curiosity, gives itself a foothold in life, thus preserving itself]

HDG.OHF.content: [encounter others] appearance of a with-world, not object of knowing, but Vorhandenheit > advance appearance (Vorschein) of factical lives of others: “in a with-world” > others encountered in the “with-”world as others bringing w/ them the “one-self”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [encounter others] appearance of a with-world, not object of knowing, but Vorhandenheit > advance appearance (Vorschein) of factical lives of others: “in a with-world” > others encountered in the “with-”world as others bringing w/ them the “one-self”
